attributes.action: allow free injections for sufferers with anaphylactic shock.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This allergy is life threatening, and suffers such as a close relative on a low income, have to pay £14+ per injection.  She frequently does not have an injection on her person when needed, due to being too expensive to purchase and a short shelf life.  Therefore, her life and others in similar situations are in danger.
I understand people suffering from certain serious illnesses can get free anaphylactic injections (so I have been told - needs confirmation of this point).  
Injections such as Epipen are vital to life-threatening illness sufferers and should be free, as other medicine is for life-threatening illnesses.

Sufferers end up in hospital, which costs the NHS. more in the long run, so please may these people have free injections?
